**Description of the problem**

<!-- Please be as detailed as you can when describing an issue. The more information we have, the easier it will be for us to track this down. -->

**Full code that generated the error**

```python
import pygmt
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

table = pd.read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GenericMappingTools/pygmt/master/pygmt/tests/data/points.txt", sep=" ", header=None)

fig = pygmt.Figure()
fig.histogram(table[0], pen="1p", series=[0, 90, 10], frame=True)             # Fail
#fig.histogram(np.array(table[0]), pen="1p", series=[0, 90, 10], frame=True)  # Pass
fig.show()
```
I have to convert `table[0]` to a numpy array to make it work.

**Full error message**


comments_content.body:
Good catch, this isn't a problem restricted to just `histogram` though. I've stepped through the logic in `pygmt/clib/session.py` and believe it's a problem with the `vectors_to_arrays` function not handling a 1D `pandas.Series` properly, specifically this line:

https://github.com/GenericMappingTools/pygmt/blob/d2cb8b953f08478666e3d3e3dda302a680679c17/pygmt/clib/conversion.py#L161

The list comprehension would loop through all the rows in the `pandas.Series`, when it should just treat the entire `pandas.Series` as a single array. I.e. `arrays = vectors_to_arrays(vectors)` produces this (wrong):

```
[array(43.4847),
 array(22.331),
 array(40.8023),
 array(49.876),
 array(60.6897),
 array(27.779),
 array(40.3582),
 array(18.9422),
 array(20.7545),
 array(19.8565),
 array(19.9855),
 array(46.4844),
 array(43.2328),
 array(59.3526),
 array(16.7597),
 array(32.3278),
 array(11.5309),
 array(61.7074),
 array(28.1125),
 array(47.8333)]
```

when it should actually produce this (correct):

```
[array([43.4847, 22.331 , 40.8023, 49.876 , 60.6897, 27.779 , 40.3582,
        18.9422, 20.7545, 19.8565, 19.9855, 46.4844, 43.2328, 59.3526,
        16.7597, 32.3278, 11.5309, 61.7074, 28.1125, 47.8333])]
```
and this is why `rows = len(arrays[0])` produces the `TypeError: len() of unsized object`, because it is only picking up `array(43.4847)` instead of `array(([43.4847, 22.331 ,...,])`

This may or may not be a duplicate of #1132 actually, since a `pandas.Series` is basically a 1D array, whereas we expect a 2D `pandas.DataFrame` array input into the `table` parameter (1D `numpy.array` objects are treated differently). But it's helpful to have the example test case above to debug the situation :smile:

**Edit**: Actually there's probably several solutions to fix this bug, another way is to refactor the `virtualfile_from_data` function to handle `pandas.Series` objects properly since we're thinking of it already at https://github.com/GenericMappingTools/pygmt/pull/990#discussion_r587040494. Will do a bit more testing.

title: Histogram doesn't work for pandas.Series
